intro: Pratia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan pratia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters. Pratia guatemalensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
